comments.commentBody: It was involved because it is responsible for criminal activity on the Internet. According to the affidavit, it only started investigating when indiscreet quotes from the site's owner in the media was brought to its attention.

There is no federal law against prostitution, and it's legal in Nevada.  The only reason for the federal government to get involved is to grab some money and try to garner some fame as 'law enforcers' when that's not their task.

It's like the sodomy laws before Lawrence v. Texas. A lot of states had them but they didn't enforce them. It took some high-profile egregious cases of selective enforcement to make the mainstream of our community wake up and realize it wasn't acceptable. I'm hoping this ridiculous raid will move forward the conversation on decriminalizing sex work and mitigation the exploitation of sex workers. If acting EDNY US Attorney Kelly Currie wants to avoid the appearance of attacking the gay community, she should not seek jail time for the Rentboy site operators but figure out a way to get the operators to make the website operate safely for the advertisers.

I agree. The authorities are always raiding straight prostitution venues so why is it homophobic when they hit a gay venue? This vastly different than the days when they were targeting gay bars and arresting the patrons. We would have a beef if it were only same sex prostitution that was illegal or targeted.

We are winning equality, slowly, I will admit. But one way to really retard our progress it to make illogical or non-claims. Make sure when you yell discrimination or oppression it actually is. (But when the oppression and/or discrimination is real -yell loudly!)

I'm as "sex positive" a gay man as there is, but we can't scream homophobia or that we were targeted when the site was clearly doing something illegal.

Like Alex Garner, I, too, believe that we should be talking about legalizing prostitution. But this led me to ask myself why I wasn't having that conversation before now. Garner needs to realize that "we" includes him -- and me and everyone else who was content with the status quo until it affected our community so publicly.
Why no mention of the fabulous ethnic food in Queens.  That's a major attraction.
Don't be so harshly self-righteous, LMC. I can see where Kayemtee might feel like a fish out of water.
That doesn't mean I have to shut up about it, QED. Gentrification is a raw deal for anyone but the gentry.
why "this" case? specifically because??

Yeah yeah, tell me about global warming. Creationism.

Open dialogue from a conservative? What a farce.

You want to kniw what a phony conservative is?

Easy. One way. Read Burke, then watch Fox News. Pure phony.

Another easy one.

Check to see if each state that was a traitor to the United States of America is pursuing its own unique, politics today as is should by conservative principles. Hahahahahah. All Fox News monoculture, like tea partiers. See the thing is, if state's rights and there are real conservatives this is IMPOSSIBLE it is a REPUDIATION of state's rights and conservaive principles.

Phony.

Phonies, every one.
So they found a little niche site and missed Madison Ashley? Why do you think that may be? Make a couple guesses and I'll let you know if you're getting warmer.

G -- That is true, and it must change. Intelligent policy begins with serious research on what would work.

I have posted specific suggestions here before. That degenerates into denigrating specifics.

Today I wanted to emphasize serious research effort to identify what would work. That degenerated too.

The topic is too important to avoid. It is very difficult to discuss in any productive way in the midst of this heat.

I saw the video. It is stomach turning. This was awful. How can anybody do that?
Again, there is no federal law against prostitution and it's legal in Nevada.  Can DHS raid every porn shop in America because selling marital aids is illegal in Alabama?
All laws are not enforced equally.  Some laws are only enforced when there is another purpose.
Do you cook the red lentils?
Love this recipe... have made it at least four times... a nice addition is some feta cheese.
Maybe the press is paying attention to Trump because he's the leading candidate for the Republican's Presidential candidate.  It would be irresponsible to ignore him.

the only question that I have about trump is - why are journalists so committed to airing his every move and statement? Haven't they realized that that is exactly what he wants? It is mostly not news. I am particularly disturbed by the tendencies of the NYT to follow the same course as internet talking heads where a click equals cash and not just about trump but other things as well. what has happened to the times?

Trump's grandstanding, caustic, erratic, bombastic, antagonistic spectacles are always a win in his own eyes, since he soaks up attention like a sponge.  An adult acting out may be within the norm for reality TV, but we are doomed if the self-made drama hits the White House.
On the contrary, many thinking people finally recognize the Washington-Wall Stree-lobbyist scam for what it is: Gaming the System and Skimming the Cream from our emaciated Middle Class

"How much am I suing Univision for? It's 500 million. They are very worried about this - and I have to tell you, I'm very good at this stuff."
This pretty much sums up how Trump has accumulated his billions, claiming bankruptcies, evading creditors and taxes and calling out the lawyers to sue when every opportunity arises. It's how a crude buffoon claims a place in the 1% then brags endlessly about it. This is why he has an appeal with the GOP rank and file - he achieved success without earning it, cheating when necessary and he demonstrated that even poorly spoken idiot can get rich. Head over to the comments on the youtube link in this article and you'll see the type of fan base he attracts. American politics is more and more disturbing . . .

I am not so sure that your view is representative of the rest of the country, Phyllis.  Brentwood is not exactly a slice of America.  Spending a day in Brentwood, as I often do, one could come away with the impression that football, eating meat, and driving american cars are "over" as well.

Let's NOT hope Trump's flame "burns out."  We all NEED him to shake up that Evil Axis of Congress & Wall Street, with ALL their insider trading, gaming the system, revolving lobbyists/Goldman Sachs/Koch Bros....all succeeding in massacring the Middle Class.  We NEED a Trump Victory !
My whole life, I have been told that women are too emotionally unstable to be suitable for President.  To that sexist, dismissive attitude I point to The ever-theatrical Donald!
Apologize for what, exactly? For asking the tough questions that others aren't?  Thankfully some journalists still remember what their job is!

If turnabout is fair play, I would encourage Bill O'Reilly to use Mr Ramos' approach with Hillary the next time she has a non-news conference, I am sure all that enjoyed Mr Ramos decision to attempt to make the news conference his own would be just as supportive of a Fox News personality doing the same.

"This era of appeasement to those who want rules altered for them while the rest of [us] must quietly abide is a low point of society."

Absolutely brilliantly and succinctly stated. Thank you. This is more wisdom in one sentence than the entire political reportorial staff of the NYT (and their editorial masters) is able to bring to bear with all their spilled ink.
That Trump is a xenophobic bully and a misogynist boor is no surprise.  The surprise is how many in the GOP admire those qualities.
Terri: are you suggesting that people shouldn't listen to those you disagree with? You don't want others to hear the opposite point of view?

There are lots of good jokes, the Donald doesn't have a monopoly on jokes.  A good one will be whatever will be said by the NRA's Republican party candidates in reaction to today's horrible shootings in Virginia.  How about a dusty trash can of awful ex-governors who wouldn't stand a chance of winning their own states?     I know, perhaps these aren't that funny, really.
Trump is a joke and what scares me is that people are listening - even the NYTimes

You seem to have absolutely no idea what you're spewing there, Al. Not only does the 14th Amendment very clearly include birthright citizenship, not only has it been very clearly understood to include birthright citizenship from the moment it was presented for a vote, not only had the concept been a part of American common law from the start of migration to North America, but it originated in English common law before the Western Hemisphere was 'discovered'.  The concept of birthright citizenship first came under attack during the Irish famine migration to the U.S. in the 1840s and, again, during the later Italian migration; but there has never actually been any plausible argument that the 14th Amendment did not include the concept.  Modern radical revisionists, however, pretending to be 'conservative' while typically acting in ways which strongly belie use of the term, have apparently decided that since the 14th Amendment is more than one hundred years old most Americans won't have any clue as to its existence or history and can easily be duped into accepting their/your absurdly ridiculous and false characterization of it.

"The absence of anything resembling a conventional political filter has left political veterans stunned"

That political filter is he universal code of the political class, that the public is to be manipulated, fed innocuous sound bites with the hope that yours can make them hate he opposition more, while accepting you.

So, he displayed his need for power -- that is the other side of vulnerability. And his taking on birthright citizenship is perfectly legitimate. It was never included in the 14th Amendment after a debate on the desirability of allowing the child of anyone who managed to be on this soil by any method to have citizenship. The absurdity of this legitimate discussion devolving in a battle of the buzzword, "anchor baby" = bad, birthright citizenship = good, is emblematic of what discourse on political issues have descended to.

With Trump we get a personality, with the others we get a manufactured filtered persona. If he didn't spout such simplistic bombastic nonsense, (even though less than his Republican contenders) I could actually cheer the guy on.

AlRodbell.com

A report, without raising his voice, knowing he will be ignored if he does not speak out decides to do what all of the press should have done long time ago and failed to do: asks a hard question.

And what does Mr. Trump do, the so-called master of negotiators, the strongman, the wannabe leader of the Free World? He crumbles completely, unaccustomed to not bossing employees around.

Mr. Trump has now been revealed as an empty suit, a weakling hiding behind false bravado, an emperor without clothes... needy and timorous, an entertainer no longer entertaining.

Bravo to Mr. Ramos --he did what the press needed to do long time ago-- and by asking questions and not cowering before power and celebrity, or money, gave us a true glimpse of Mr. Trump --and it is not pretty.
